014package org.jdbi.v3.testing.junit5;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.util.Arrays;
018import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
019import java.util.Optional;
020import java.util.Set;
021import java.util.function.Consumer;
022
023import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
024import javax.annotation.Nullable;
025import javax.sql.DataSource;
026
027import de.softwareforge.testing.postgres.junit5.EmbeddedPgExtension;
028import org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle;
029import org.jdbi.v3.core.Jdbi;
030import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
031import org.jdbi.v3.core.spi.JdbiPlugin;
032import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.AfterEachCallback;
033import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.BeforeEachCallback;
034import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ExtensionContext;
035import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ParameterContext;
036import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ParameterResolver;
037
038/**
039 * Common functionality for all JUnit 5 extensions.
040 * <p>
041 * Subclasses can be used with the {@code @ExtendWith} annotation to declare an extension if they provide a public no-args constructor.
042 * <p>
043 * When using declarative registration, test methods can declare a {@link Jdbi} and/or a {@link Handle} parameter which is injected through this extension. The
044 * {@link #getJdbi()} is used to obtain the {@link Jdbi} object and {@link #getSharedHandle()}} is used for the {@link Handle} instance.
045 * <p>
046 * Programmatic registration is preferred as this allows further customization of each extension.
047 *
048 * @see JdbiH2Extension
049 * @see JdbiPostgresExtension
050 * @see JdbiSqliteExtension
051 * @see JdbiExternalPostgresExtension
052 * @see JdbiOtjPostgresExtension
053 */
054public abstract class JdbiExtension implements BeforeEachCallback, AfterEachCallback, ParameterResolver {
055
056    private final Set<JdbiPlugin> plugins = new LinkedHashSet<>();
057    private Optional<JdbiExtensionInitializer> initializerMaybe = Optional.empty();
058
059    private boolean installPlugins = false;
060
061    private volatile Jdbi jdbi;
062    private volatile Handle sharedHandle;
063
064    private volatile boolean dataSourceInitialized = false;
065    private volatile DataSource dataSource;
066
067    /**
068     * Creates a new extension using a managed, embedded postgres database. Using this method requires the <code>de.softwareforge.testing:pg-embedded</code>
069     * component and the postgres JDBC driver on the class path.
070     * <p>
071     * It references an embedded pg extension, which must be added to the class independently and can be managed as a per-class extension, not a per-method
072     * extension:
073     *
074     * <pre>{@code
075     *     @RegisterExtension
076     *     public static EmbeddedPgExtension pg = MultiDatabaseBuilder.instanceWithDefaults().build();
077     *
078     *     @RegisterExtension
079     *     public JdbiExtension postgres = JdbiExtension.postgres(pg);
080     * }</pre>
081     * <p>
082     * This is the most efficient way to run multiple tests within the same class that use a postgres database.
083     *
084     * @param pg Reference to an embedded postgres database. This extension must be separately added to the test class.
085     * @return A {@link JdbiExtension} connected to a managed postgres data source.
086     * @see JdbiPostgresExtension
087     */
088    public static JdbiExtension postgres(EmbeddedPgExtension pg) {
089        return JdbiPostgresExtension.instance(pg);
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * Creates an extension that uses an external (outside the scope of an unit test class) postgres database. Using this method requires the postgres JDBC
094     * driver on the classpath.
095     *
096     * @param hostname Hostname of the database.
097     * @param port     Port of the database. Can be null, in that case the default port is used.
098     * @param database Database name.
099     * @param username Username to access the database. Can be null.
100     * @param password Password to access the database. Can be null.
101     * @return A {@link JdbiExtension} connected to an external postgres data source.
102     * @see JdbiExternalPostgresExtension
103     */
104    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseObjectForClearerAPI")
105    public static JdbiExtension externalPostgres(@Nonnull String hostname,
106        @Nullable Integer port,
107        @Nonnull String database,
108        @Nullable String username,
109        @Nullable String password) {
110        return JdbiExternalPostgresExtension.instance(hostname, port, database, username, password);
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Creates a new extension using a managed, embedded postgres database. Using this method requires the <code>com.opentable.components:otj-pg-embedded</code>
115     * component and the postgres JDBC driver on the class path.
116     *
117     * <pre>{@code
118     *     @RegisterExtension
119     *     public JdbiExtension postgres = JdbiExtension.otjEmbeddedPostgres();
120     * }</pre>
121     * <p>
122     * Compared to the {@link #postgres(EmbeddedPgExtension)} method, this extension spins up a new postgres instance for each test method and is slower. It
123     * should only be used to migrate existing code that uses the JUnit 4 {@link org.jdbi.v3.testing.JdbiRule} quickly to JUnit 5.
124     *
125     * @return A {@link JdbiExtension} connected to a managed postgres data source.
126     * @see JdbiOtjPostgresExtension
127     */
128    public static JdbiOtjPostgresExtension otjEmbeddedPostgres() {
129        return JdbiOtjPostgresExtension.instance();
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * Creates a new extension using the H2 database. Each call to this method creates a new database which is transient and in-memory. Using this method
134     * requires the <code>com.h2database:h2</code> component on the classpath.
135     *
136     * <pre>{@code
137     *     @RegisterExtension
138     *     public JdbiExtension h2 = JdbiExtension.h2();
139     * }</pre>
140     *
141     * @return A {@link JdbiExtension} connected to a managed h2 data source.
142     * @see JdbiH2Extension
143     */
144    public static JdbiExtension h2() {
145        return JdbiH2Extension.instance();
146    }
147
148    /**
149     * Creates a new extension using the SQLite database. Each call to this method creates a new database which is transient and in-memory. Using this method
150     * requires the <code>org.xerial:sqlite-jdbc</code> component on the classpath.
151     *
152     * <pre>{@code
153     *     @RegisterExtension
154     *     public JdbiExtension sqlite = JdbiExtension.sqlite();
155     * }</pre>
156     *
157     * @return A {@link JdbiExtension} connected to a managed sqlite data source.
158     * @see JdbiSqliteExtension
159     */
160    public static JdbiExtension sqlite() {
161        return JdbiSqliteExtension.instance();
162    }
163
164    protected JdbiExtension() {}
165
166    /**
167     * Returns a {@link Jdbi} instance linked to the data source used by this extension. There is only a single Jdbi instance and multiple calls to this method
168     * return the same instance.
169     *
170     * @return A {@link Jdbi} instance.
171     */
172    public final Jdbi getJdbi() {
173        if (jdbi == null) {
174            throw new IllegalStateException("jdbi is null!");
175        }
176
177        return jdbi;
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Returns a JDBC url representing the data source used by this extension. This url is database-specific and may or may not be used to connect to the data
182     * source outside testing code that uses this extension (e.g. the {@link JdbiSqliteExtension} returns a constant uri for all database instances).
183     *
184     * @return A string representing the JDBC URL.
185     */
186    public abstract String getUrl();
187
188    /**
189     * Returns a shared {@link Handle} used by the extension. This handle exists during the lifetime of the extension and is connected to the data source used
190     * by the extension. Multiple calls to this method always return the same instance.
191     *
192     * @return A {@link Handle} instance.
193     */
194    public final Handle getSharedHandle() {
195        if (sharedHandle == null) {
196            throw new IllegalStateException("sharedHandle is null!");
197        }
198
199        return sharedHandle;
200    }
201
202    /**
203     * When creating the {@link Jdbi} instance, call the {@link Jdbi#installPlugins()} method, which loads all plugins discovered by the {@link
204     * java.util.ServiceLoader} API.
205     *
206     * @return The extension itself for chaining method calls.
207     */
208    public final JdbiExtension installPlugins() {
209        this.installPlugins = true;
210
211        return this;
212    }
213
214    /**
215     * Install a {@link JdbiPlugin} when creating the {@link Jdbi} instance.
216     *
217     * @param plugin A plugin to install.
218     * @return The extension itself for chaining method calls.
219     */
220    public final JdbiExtension withPlugin(JdbiPlugin plugin) {
221        plugins.add(plugin);
222
223        return this;
224    }
225
226    /**
227     * Install multiple {@link JdbiPlugin}s when creating the {@link Jdbi} instance.
228     *
229     * @param pluginList One or more {@link JdbiPlugin} instances.
230     * @return The extension itself for chaining method calls.
231     */
232    public final JdbiExtension withPlugins(JdbiPlugin... pluginList) {
233        this.plugins.addAll(Arrays.asList(pluginList));
234
235        return this;
236    }
237
238    /**
239     * Sets a {@link JdbiExtensionInitializer} to initialize the {@link Jdbi} instance or the attached data source before running a test.
240     *
241     * @return The extension itself for chaining method calls.
242     */
243    public final JdbiExtension withInitializer(JdbiExtensionInitializer initializer) {
244        if (initializer == null) {
245            throw new IllegalStateException("initializer is null!");
246        }
247
248        if (initializerMaybe.isPresent()) {
249            throw new IllegalStateException("initializer already defined!");
250        }
251
252        this.initializerMaybe = Optional.of(initializer);
253
254        return this;
255    }
256
257    /**
258     * Open a new {@link Handle} to the used data source. Multiple calls to this method return multiple instances that are all connected to the same data
259     * source.
260     *
261     * @return A {@link Handle} object. The handle must be closed to release the database connection.
262     */
263    public final Handle openHandle() {
264        return getJdbi().open();
265    }
266
267    /**
268     * Set a {@link JdbiConfig} parameter when creating the {@link Jdbi} instance. Any {@link JdbiConfig} type can be referenced in this method call.
269     *
270     * <pre>{@code
271     *     @RegisterExtension
272     *     public JdbiExtension h2Extension = JdbiExtension.h2().withPlugin(new SqlObjectPlugin())
273     *             .withConfig(RowMappers.class, r -> r.register(Foo.class, new FooMapper());
274     * }</pre>
275     *
276     * @param configClass A class instance which must implement {@link JdbiConfig}.
277     * @param configurer  A {@link Consumer} to access the {@link JdbiConfig} instance.
278     * @param <C>         The config type. Must extend {@link JdbiConfig}.
279     * @return The extension itself for chaining method calls.
280     */
281    public final <C extends JdbiConfig<C>> JdbiExtension withConfig(Class<C> configClass, Consumer<C> configurer) {
282        return withPlugin(ConfiguringPlugin.of(configClass, configurer));
283    }
284
285    /**
286     * Convenience method to attach an extension (such as a SqlObject) to the shared handle.
287     */
288    public final <T> T attach(final Class<T> extension) {
289        return getSharedHandle().attach(extension);
290    }
291
292    protected abstract DataSource createDataSource() throws Exception;
293
294    private DataSource getDataSource() throws Exception {
295        // Taken from Guava Suppliers.memoize()
296        if (!dataSourceInitialized) {
297            synchronized (this) {
298                if (!dataSourceInitialized) {
299                    DataSource ds = createDataSource();
300                    dataSource = ds;
301                    dataSourceInitialized = true;
302                    return ds;
303                }
304            }
305        }
306        return dataSource;
307    }
308
309    @Override
310    public void beforeEach(ExtensionContext context) throws Exception {
311        if (jdbi != null) {
312            throw new IllegalStateException("jdbi has been set!");
313        }
314
315        final DataSource ds = getDataSource();
316
317        final Jdbi jdbiInstance = Jdbi.create(ds);
318
319        if (installPlugins) {
320            jdbiInstance.installPlugins();
321        }
322
323        plugins.forEach(jdbiInstance::installPlugin);
324        final Handle sharedHandleInstance = jdbiInstance.open();
325
326        this.jdbi = jdbiInstance;
327        this.sharedHandle = sharedHandleInstance;
328
329        initializerMaybe.ifPresent(i -> i.initialize(ds, sharedHandleInstance));
330    }
331
332    @Override
333    public void afterEach(ExtensionContext context) throws Exception {
334        if (sharedHandle == null) {
335            throw new IllegalStateException("shared handle was not initialized!");
336        }
337
338        try {
339            final DataSource ds = getDataSource();
340            Handle handle = sharedHandle;
341
342            initializerMaybe.ifPresent(i -> i.cleanup(ds, sharedHandle));
343
344            handle.close();
345        } finally {
346            this.dataSourceInitialized = false;
347
348            this.dataSource = null;
349            this.sharedHandle = null;
350            this.jdbi = null;
351        }
352    }
353
354    @Override
355    public boolean supportsParameter(ParameterContext parameterContext, ExtensionContext extensionContext) {
356        Type type = parameterContext.getParameter().getType();
357        return type == Jdbi.class || type == Handle.class;
358    }
359
360    @Override
361    public Object resolveParameter(ParameterContext parameterContext, ExtensionContext extensionContext) {
362        Type type = parameterContext.getParameter().getType();
363        if (type == Jdbi.class) {
364            return getJdbi();
365        } else if (type == Handle.class) {
366            return getSharedHandle();
367        }
368        return null;
369    }
370
371    private static final class ConfiguringPlugin<C extends JdbiConfig<C>> implements JdbiPlugin {
372
373        private final Class<C> configClass;
374        private final Consumer<C> configurer;
375
376        private ConfiguringPlugin(Class<C> configClass, Consumer<C> configurer) {
377            this.configClass = configClass;
378            this.configurer = configurer;
379        }
380
381        static <C extends JdbiConfig<C>> ConfiguringPlugin<C> of(Class<C> configClass, Consumer<C> configurer) {
382            return new ConfiguringPlugin<>(configClass, configurer);
383        }
384
385        @Override
386        public void customizeJdbi(Jdbi jdbi) {
387            jdbi.configure(configClass, configurer);
388        }
389    }
390}
